title: 3 Female Journalists Were Told They Couldn't Enter an NFL Locker Room
text:
Three female journalists were barred from entering an NFL locker room Sunday, despite the league's policy to admit all credentialed members of the press.
According to the Associated Press , a male usher told Graham Watson, an editor at Yahoo Sports, Joey Chandler, a sports writer at the Tuscaloosa News , and a third unidentified journalist that they couldn't enter the Jacksonville Jaguars locker room after the team's overtime loss to the Indianapolis Colts until he asked other men whether it was OK for them to go in.
 And here's the real kicker: The women were at the game in Indianapolis as part of the Associated Press Sports Editors sports media diversity weekend.
Both Watson and Chandler tweeted about the incident: ​ ​
When getting ready to enter Jags locker room with other APSE female fellows, old man tried to deny us entry. It's still 2015, right?
— Joey Chandler (@Joey_TNews) October 4, 2015
I was just blocked from a locker room by an old, out-of-touch geezer who wasn't sure women were allowed because "you know how guys are."
— Graham Watson (@Yahoo_Graham) October 4, 2015
This guy was an usher and apparently not aware that women cover sports. I about lost it. @Colts @Jaguars
— Graham Watson (@Yahoo_Graham) October 4, 2015
I have covered male sporting events all over the world and it took coming to Indianapolis to face my first gender discrimination. @NFL
— Graham Watson (@Yahoo_Graham) October 4, 2015
Watson also noted on Twitter that they were eventually allowed entry and that PR reps from both teams apologized .
